Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can attempt to draw a simple fish shape, though it may lack recognizable features like fins or gills.
The student might include water in the drawing, but it might only appear as a vague blue area.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly label the fish's body parts (e.g., labeling a fin incorrectly or not labeling the body at all).
The student may not show a specific habitat (e.g., mislabels a river as a fish tank).
The student might neglect other plants and animals in the habitat (student is focused only on the fish and its shape).
The student might not demonstrate how the fish interacts with its environment (e.g., the fish is not shown near plants it might eat or by animals).
The concept of water as a critical resource might be omitted or misunderstood (e.g., fish depicted outside of the water).
The student may not show or understand the role of sunlight in the habitat (e.g., no sun in drawing, or sun placed underwater).
